title: No, Orlando Pirates hasn’t fired player after arrest for rape of 12-year-old
subtitle: Trends Daily is at it again.
author: africacheck.org
vclaim:
Trends Daily is at it again.

The platform publishes on at least two websites –

on South African football. But this time Trends Daily has taken a real and tragic report on the

in the Eastern Cape province and used it for clickbait.

“Pirates Terminate Their Player Contract After He Was Arrested For Raping 12-Year-Old Girl,” reads the

: “A 27-year-old man who identified himself as Pirates player has been arrested in Butterworth, in the Eastern Cape, on Sunday for allegedly raping a 12-year-old girl, police said.” It was published on 19 February 2019.

Except for the headline and first paragraph, the story is a word-for-word copy of a

published on 18 February under the headline: “Eastern Cape man arrested for rape of 12-year-old girl”.

: “A 27-year-old man was arrested in Butterworth, in the Eastern Cape, on Sunday for allegedly raping a 12-year-old girl, police said.” There is no mention of the man being a Pirates player.

of Orlando Pirates terminating a player’s contract after his arrest for the rape of a child can be found.

Photo is five years old

. The photo in the post shows a handcuffed man climbing into the back of a South African police van.

shows the photo has been online since at least 2014.

It was used in an

, dated 10 November 2014, on the arrest of police officers in Parow in the Western Cape province.
